channel.title: EXP Setting

item.title: EXP Setting
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

If there are highscores which have the player’s name, what’s the point in an identification item/tag/whatever? A player could just look someone up on the highscores to see what method they chose.

Read full topic

item.title: EXP Setting
item.dc:creator: @shrogg shrogg
item.description:
@shrogg wrote:

what about having a little tag beside the players name like “shrogg (level 73) 20X” or somthing similar, or you could increace the maximum level to somthing like 120 so it is still a challange?

Read full topic

item.title: EXP Setting
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

I like this idea.
You want something that visually separates the different rates though, like an item of clothing that the player could wield?

Or else all the level 126s or whatever will still be the same, therefore it just seems like the same achievement, whether the player attained that level at the x3 rate or the x100.

Read full topic

item.title: EXP Setting
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

Example of scenario -
You finish tutorial island (or skip) and a message comes up asking for these selections.
Question: What experience rate do you want to play with?

  • Original RuneScape
  • 3x RuneScape
  • More Options
    [More options screen 1]
  • 10x RuneScape
  • 20x RuneScape
  • More Options
    [More options screen 2]
  • 50x RuneScape
  • 100x RuneScape

Note: Saying that you should be able to “enter your own exp rate” will cause chaos even with a max number (eg. “You can only go up to 1000! Try entering a different number!”) as high scores will be disorganized this way.

Rates will have their own high scores. Example
x10 High Score
x20 High Score

[code] if (command.startsWith(“checkplayer”)) {
try {
String playerExp = command.substring(9);
int playerId = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(playerId);

			if (playerId != -1) {
				clientHandler p2 = (clientHandler) GameEngine.playerHandler.players[playerId];
				p.sendMessage(+p2.playerName+" is using " +p.expRateMultiplier+ "x EXP rates.");
			}
		} catch (Exception e) {
            	           //CAUGHT ERROR
		}
	}[/code]

This would be an ingame code that displays a players exp rate multiplier. This way, you can rate whether they actually deserve praise for their achievements or not.

When you select an exp rate multiplier, if you raise any combat skills with that multiplier, you are not allow to change the multiplier.

If you wish to change multipliers your combat stats will be reset.

Thoughts on this idea?

Read full topic
